( Carnage: Interesting transformation Yanshosh and Megan.)

** He had known that she knew that he was coming, and perhaps also that he 
had been following her, but none of that mattered now as Dinobot simply 
stood there and watched Tavatron stretch.
But he had seen her look towards him before he had broken cover, not trying 
to hide his approach at all. He hadn�t missed the smile either, but at this 
moment, smile or not, it was about time to cut the pleasantries and get down 
to business.
He had indeed followed her despite his systems warnings, clearly stated in 
flashing red letters on his internal screen. Constantly relaying that his 
body wasn�t use to heavy traveling quite yet. But Dinobot had ignored it all 
and followed in Tavatrons wake, both to make sure that she didn�t run into 
trouble but also because he shill wanted to know just why she had left him 
in his time of need.
And he wasn�t going to drop the subject or let Tavatron leave until she gave 
him the proper answer, which didn�t classify as gibberish. Which was what 
people did sometimes when they didn�t want to speak about anything.

Dinobot watched Tavatron stretched her front paw one last time before she 
transformed and turned to look at him,  her optics meeting nothing but a 
blank and emotionless glare from him.
Completely hiding the betrayal and complete loss for actions he felt inside, 
only one question beating like his fastly paced spark in his mind. Why?
Why did she run away from me?
Why does she run away from her problems?
Why does she run away from who she is?
All of those questions ran through Dinobots mind faster then the beating 
ache of pain in his side which was slowly fading, enough to move the clawed 
fore-limb from his side.
Now being able to stand squarely.
But all of this, even his own actions puzzled him to a point. Never before 
had he ever actually chased down someone to answer something in which they 
seemed to be running away from.
Usually he would have just given up on them and basically thought to the Pit 
with it!
He would have never been standing there right at that moment by the edge of 
a cliff, glaring at the fembot whom he just COULDN�T give up as a friend.
Or, perhaps it had been more then that. But either way, he was there now and 
he wasn�t going back to base. Even though he had received that transmission 
from Kluster.
Though, Dinobot did feel an impulse to obey that command, he wasn�t under 
that Maximal�s rule; so his kindly worded request he would pay no heed to 
for the moment.
But now it was time to get to what he had come there for, or at least the 
main reason anyway.
Dinobot shifted his weight for a moment, wondering slightly if he should 
transform as well, but the fact that he still needed time to heal keep him 
in beast mode.
A growl emanated from his throat at Tavatrons words, the only reply to them 
with which he gave. His glare continued for a moment to deepen the words he 
snarled.**

� In yet, I still receive no explanation for your action. When I am almost 
positive you expect one from me.�

** Dinobot moved towards the edge of the cliff, passing Tavatron with little 
more then a glance.
He peered over the edge of the rock drop, seeing the waving canopy of forest 
below. But then he raised his eyes from the hights and turned his head 
towards Tavatron, them no longer narrowed but his voice just as flat as 
before. But his head was a bit lowered, almost as if somebot was forcing 
this out of him, even though he knew that that one was himself.**

� If it is an apology you wish, then you�may have it.�

** She had no idea just how much will power he was using just to get this 
all out, so he hoped that if nothing more she appreciated it. Growling.**

� I had�no right to attack your honor and place as a warrior back there. 
However, with your past actions, also including your current offence, I had 
every right to have both of those factors in doubt. I fact, I still do.
But I still had no right to attack you like that.�

** And that was as close to an apology Tavatron was going to get from him, 
feeling no reason to say anything further.
Dinobot then turned his eyes towards the edge of the cliff once again, 
eventually following a flock of small birds as they lifted from the forest 
top and disappeared into the distance.
But then his eyes narrowed and he growled, either expecting Tavatron to 
question exactly what she had done in the past to make him question her 
honor and skills, or to hear her take her turn at the apology. Though, 
before she could reply he had one more thing to apply. Looking over his 
shoulder at the fembot.**

� However, I am very disappointed in you, despite my coming here.�

** Turning his head forward again, his words said and over with. Now he was 
ready to receive the question or the apology.
Even to argue this out, as long as they did something, said something, got 
everything out in the open. As long as one of those was achieved then and 
only then would he be satisfied.
But Dinobot hunkered his shoulders up a bit in annoyance anyway, still not 
even believing that this one bot, this WOMAN�had gotten an apology from him. 
Of all the things in the universe, there was nothing he hated more then to 
admit his faults, for anybot.
But now he had done it, and if Tavatron said anything emplying that it was 
sweet or even nice, he was going back to base without her.**
